content.raw:
Ahh humm maybe this is because I asked Ian to edit the model at its current pose. I was thinking of mobile robots, if it moves very far away from its initial pose and you try to edit it, it seems like it just disappeared, because it would go back to the initial position and maybe you're too zoomed in to see it.

I'm not sure what would be the best solution here. Maybe leave it at the original pose but move the camera there?

However, I can think of a case when the user carefully placed a lot of models, then tries to edit one of them and it moves to the pose it was originally placed at, and it ends up on top of something else making it difficult to edit...

Another idea is to have a button just to make the model upright at the current position... Overkill?
